div.l: That I have ete wᵗith the stubbed gos
For in thi shoppe ther͗e is mony a flee los
Now telle on gentell Roger͗e bi thi name
But yet I prey the be not wroth for game
Thou seyst full soth ꝙquod Roger bi my fay
Thou seydest not a sother word to day
But seth pleye is pleye as flemyng seyth
And ther fore herny baily bi thi feyth
¶ Be not wroth or we departen here
Thaugh that my tale be of an hostylere
But natheles I wol not telle hit yet
But or we departe hit shall be quyt
And there wᵗith al he lough ⁊and made chere
And seyde his tale ye shull here
Here bigynneth the Cookes tale
A Prentys som tyme dwelled in our͗e cyte
And of a craft of vytaile was he
Gaylard he was as goldsmyth in shawe
Browne as a bery a propur͗e shert felawe
Wᵗith lockes blake kempt full fetesly
Daunce he couthe full wel ⁊and Iolily
That he was cleped Perkyn reuelour͗e
He was as full of loue ⁊and paramour͗e
As is the hyue full on hony swete
Wel was the wenche that him myghte mete
At euery brydale wolte he synge ⁊and hoppe
He loued better the tauerne then the shoppe
For when eny rydyng was in to chepe
Out of the shoppe thider wolde he lepe
Till that he had al the sight y seyne
And daunced wel he wolde not come a yeyne
To hoppe ⁊and synge ⁊and make such disport
